00028 namespace {
00029 struct zerodata_t: public data_t<> {
00030     public:
00031     zerodata_t() { copies=1; length=max_length=1; *magnitude=0; }
00032 } zerodata;
00033 } // namespace
00034 
00035 base_integer::base_integer(size_t count, digit_t mask, void *d):
00036     fixed_mask(mask), negative(false), data(reinterpret_cast<data_t<>*>(d))
00037 {
00038     assert(mask != 0);
00039 
00040     data->copies=1;
00041     data->length=1;
00042     data->max_length=count;
00043 
00044     digit_t *i = data->magnitude, *ie = i + data->max_length;
00045     while (i != ie) *i++ = 0;
00046 }
00047 
00048 base_integer::~base_integer() {
00049     if (fixed_mask != 0 && data && data->copies == 1) deallocate(data);
00050 }

00052 digit_t base_integer::_get_digit(size_t index) const {
00053     return data->magnitude[index];
00054 }
00055 
00056 digit_t base_integer::_get_digit(size_t index, bool) const {
00057     if (index >= data->length) return 0;
00058     return data->magnitude[index];
00059 }

00070     return data->length;

00073 void base_integer::_duplicate(const base_integer& c, size_t extra) {
00074     negative=c.negative;
00075     data=duplicate(data, c.data, extra);
00076 }
00077 
00078 void base_integer::_attach(data_t<> *new_data, bool neg) {
00079     assert(fixed_mask == 0);
00080 
00081     #ifdef XINT_DISABLE_COPY_ON_WRITE
00082         data=duplicate(data, new_data);
00083     #else
00084         if (data && --data->copies == 0) deallocate(data);
00085         data=new_data;
00086         if (data) ++data->copies;
00087     #endif
00088     negative=neg;
00089 }
00090 
00091 void base_integer::_attach(const base_integer& copy) {
00092     _attach(copy.data, copy.negative);
00093 }
00094 
00095 void base_integer::_attach_0() {
00096     _attach(&zerodata);
00097 }
00098 
00099 void base_integer::_attach_1(digit_t n) {
00100     if (n == 0) {
00101         _attach(&zerodata);
00102     } else {
00103         _attach(allocate(1));
00104         *data->magnitude=n;
00105     }
00106 }

00108 void base_integer::_attach_n(boost::uintmax_t n) {
00109     static int bits = std::numeric_limits<boost::uintmax_t>::digits;
00110     static int maxDigits = (bits + bits_per_digit - 1) / bits_per_digit;
00111 
00112     _attach(allocate(maxDigits));
00113     _set_n(n);
00114 }
00115 
00116 void base_integer::_set_n(boost::uintmax_t n) {
00117     // Assumes that the proper allocation was already done
00118     data->length = data->max_length;
00119     digit_t *i = data->magnitude, *ie = i + data->max_length;
00120     while (n != 0 && i != ie) {
00121         *i++ = digit_t(n & digit_mask);
00122         n >>= bits_per_digit;
00123     }
00124     _cleanup();
00125 }
00126 
00127 bool base_integer::_is_unique() const {
00128     return (!data || data->copies == 1);
00129 }
00130 
00131 bool base_integer::_is_zero() const {
00132     return (data->length == 1 && *data->magnitude == 0);
00133 }

00136     return negative;

00139 void base_integer::_set_negative(bool neg) {
00140     negative=neg;
00141 }

00143 void base_integer::_cleanup() {
00144     if (fixed_mask) data->magnitude[data->max_length-1] &= fixed_mask;
00145     digit_t *p = data->magnitude + data->length - 1;
00146     while (p != data->magnitude && *p == 0) { --data->length; --p; }
00147     if (data->length == 1 && *data->magnitude == 0) negative = false;
00148 
00149 }
00150 
00151 void base_integer::_realloc(size_t new_digit_count) {
00152     assert(fixed_mask == 0);
00153     data = reallocate(data, new_digit_count);
00154 }

00156 void base_integer::_shift_left(size_t byBits) {
00157     size_t bytes=byBits / bits_per_digit, bits=byBits % bits_per_digit;
00158     size_t oldLength = data->length;
00159 
00160     data=reallocate(data, data->length + bytes + 1);
00161 
00162     if (bits != 0) {
00163         // Handle both bits and bytes in one pass
00164         digit_t *s = data->magnitude + oldLength - 1, *t = s + bytes + 1;
00165 
00166         *t-- = *s >> (bits_per_digit - bits);
00167         while (s > data->magnitude) {
00168             *t = (*s-- << bits);
00169             *t-- |= (*s >> (bits_per_digit - bits));
00170         }
00171         *t = (*s << bits);
00172 
00173         if (bytes != 0) {
00174             digit_t *t = data->magnitude, *te = t + bytes;
00175             while (t != te) *t++ = 0;
00176         }
00177     } else if (bytes != 0) {
00178         memmove(data->magnitude + bytes, data->magnitude, sizeof(digit_t) *
00179             oldLength);
00180         memset(data->magnitude, 0, sizeof(digit_t) * bytes);
00181     }
00182     _cleanup();
00183 }
00184 
00185 void base_integer::_shift_right(size_t byBits) {
00186     size_t bytes=byBits / bits_per_digit, bits=byBits % bits_per_digit,
00187         bits2 = bits_per_digit - bits;
00188 
00189     if (bytes >= data->length) {
00190         // Right-shift it into oblivion.
00191         data->length = 1;
00192         *data->magnitude = 0;
00193     } else if (bits != 0) {
00194         // Handle both bits and bytes in one pass
00195         digit_t *t = data->magnitude, *s = data->magnitude + bytes,
00196             *se = data->magnitude + data->length - 1;
00197         while (s!=se) {
00198             *t = (*s++ >> bits);
00199             *t++ |= (*s << bits2);
00200         }
00201         *t = (*s >> bits);
00202         if (bytes != 0) {
00203             memset(data->magnitude + data->length - bytes, 0, sizeof(digit_t) *
00204                 bytes);
00205             data->length -= bytes;
00206         }
00207         _cleanup();
00208     } else if (bytes != 0) {
00209         memmove(data->magnitude, data->magnitude + bytes, sizeof(digit_t) *
00210             (data->length - bytes));
00211         memset(data->magnitude + data->length - bytes, 0, sizeof(digit_t) *
00212             bytes);
00213         data->length -= bytes;
00214         _cleanup();
00215     }
00216 }

00218 void base_integer::_base_make_unique() {
00219     if (!_is_unique()) data=duplicate(data);
00220 }

00222 void base_integer::_add(const base_integer& n) {
00223     //assert(mCopies==1);
00224     //assert(mLength >= addend.mLength);
00225 
00226     // The answer to any addition problem contains, at most, one digit more
00227     // than the largest addend.
00228     data=reallocate(data, data->length + 1);
00229 
00230     // Now add the digits, starting at the least-significant digit.
00231     digit_t carry = 0;
00232     size_t x = 0;
00233     for (; x < n.data->length; ++x) {
00234         doubledigit_t t = doubledigit_t(data->magnitude[x]) +
00235             n.data->magnitude[x] + carry;
00236         if (t >= digit_overflowbit) { carry = 1; t -= digit_overflowbit; }
00237             else carry=0;
00238         data->magnitude[x] = static_cast<digit_t>(t);
00239     }
00240 
00241     while (carry) {
00242         doubledigit_t t = doubledigit_t(data->magnitude[x]) + 1;
00243         if (t >= digit_overflowbit) { carry = 1; t -= digit_overflowbit; }
00244             else carry=0;
00245         data->magnitude[x] = static_cast<digit_t>(t);
00246         ++x;
00247     }
00248 
00249     _cleanup();
00250 }
00251 
00252 void base_integer::_subtract(const base_integer& n) {
00253     //assert(mCopies==1);
00254     //assert(mLength >= subtrahend.mLength);
00255 
00256     // For subtraction, the answer will always be less than or equal to the
00257     // size of the longest operand, so we've already got enough room.
00258 
00259     // Now subtract the digits, starting at the least-significant one.
00260     size_t x;
00261     int borrow = 0;
00262     doubledigit_t t;
00263     for (x = 0; x < n.data->length; ++x) {
00264         t=(data->magnitude[x] + digit_overflowbit) - n.data->magnitude[x] -
00265             borrow;
00266         if (t < digit_overflowbit) borrow = 1;
00267         else { borrow = 0; t -= digit_overflowbit; }
00268         data->magnitude[x]=static_cast<digit_t>(t);
00269     }
00270 
00271     for (; x < data->length && borrow; ++x) {
00272         t = (data->magnitude[x] + digit_overflowbit) - borrow;
00273         if (t < digit_overflowbit) borrow=1;
00274         else { borrow = 0; t -= digit_overflowbit; }
00275         data->magnitude[x] = static_cast<digit_t>(t);
00276     }
00277 
00278     _cleanup();
00279     if (borrow != 0) negative=!negative;
00280 }
